The size I ordered was too large and this romper definitely runs big on the bottom, so I'd recommend it for someone with more of a pear shape.
I have a long torso, so I think rompers just aren't ever going to work for me!

links_reviews_title: It fit great and felt super comfortable.
links_reviews_text: The material is nice and I didn't have to wear a bra because the material is thick enough. Pockets on the front and back are great and the shoulder straps were adjustable which made the fit very custom. The only thing I didn't like was that there was too much material over the stomach portion or the pleats made it seem puffy there. It wasn't noticeable by others until I sat down and it would poof out. However, I am blessed with a FLAT stomach (not as blessed on the hips and thighs) so maybe this was just a bad fit over my stomach and not a problem in most other customers. I got lots of complements and it was fun to wear.

links_reviews_title: I did not wear this piece.
links_reviews_text: The bottom bubbles up between the waist and the hips. It looked strange.

This was outside of my comfort zone - my first real foray into rompers - but I loved it. It is incredibly flattering on. The subtle seersucker pattern is a nice touch but not too in-your-face preppy. I am 5'9" and I was concerned about the length of the shorts, especially for sitting at dinner. It was a little short, but I didn't feel uncomfortable or like it rode up so much that I looked like I was just wearing a body suit. I would definitely rent this again in the summer or for a warm weather vacation.
This romper was great! It was a lot of fun to wear and great for the summer weekend around town look. The fit was just perfect and the adjustable straps were great and a nice touch.
Loved the fit of this - super cute and light weight for warm weather.

Fit was true to size and the straps are adjustable. It's almost a seersucker fabric. The fit was TTS, not difficult to get off and on which is a plus in #romperlife. A heavier seersucker so I don't know that I'd wear it on the hottest day. I'm short, so it also seemed a little long on the shorts, then the short portion also had pleating so it felt a little Nurse Pollyanna. But! I wore it and I did like it, just wouldn't buy it. It had pockets too!
Love this romper - super flattering fit, perfect for a summer party

It fit perfectly and the adjustable shoulder straps helped make sure that you had the right torso length when wearing it. This was perfect for a day event in the sun and breathed nicely with the fabric. I was a little worried that it would be too tight across my chest, but it fit really well and came in with a nice flattering waist. The short length when standing was perfect - around mid-thigh, but as with most rompers when sitting it did get a little high up the leg, but nothing too risky
This felt very boxy on me. It is thick material, which I appreciate when wearing white. Nothing to write home about.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful but has some bagginess on the crotch area
links_reviews_text: Looks kind of weird. I wore it anyways and got lots of compliments, so maybe it was all in my head. Lol

i'm typically a 4, but always a 2 in tibi. this fit fine in a 2, but since there was no stretch in the waist, as i consumed more and more food it started to feel tight! it was fitted around the chest and waist, but looser around the hips so can look a touch like bloomer, but didn't bother me at all. loved the pockets, wasn't too difficult to get out of considering it's a romper. overall, highly highly recommend! didn't even wrinkle as much as i thought it would!

links_reviews_title: Strangers stopped me to ask the brand
links_reviews_text: Wow better than expected. It's seersucker so it's light and breezy. But the waist and straps give it structure to be fitted and flattering. The shorts part are a little bit long for me. I wore wedges to try to lengthen. I'd rent again in heartbeat.

Easy to wear romper, larger cut but fitted at the waist. Shoulder straps are adjustable, note the copper color of hardware. Shoulder straps allow for nice fit but i tend to think it may be a challenge for taller women to wear.

links_reviews_title: Perfect for a date with my Valentine
links_reviews_text: Mine did not come with a belt as shown, but looked good without it anyway. I didn't wear the liner for the dress but instead did a long sleeve shirt and leggings since it was a chilly Feb day. Got lots of compliments from strangers, it's a unique and fun dress.

Wore this for lunch with my husband on Valentine's Day. It's a super cool dress and I received lots of compliments, but I had to make it work. It is a little tight in the bust, big in hips and a little short. The lining it came with was really short. I wore with a longer slip and tights. It fit a little babydoll-ish, so I wore a jacket over it. Otherwise, I might have looked pregnant. But, the material was so cool, especially for the day, that I just made it work.

links_reviews_title: So beautiful! Got tons of compliments!
links_reviews_text: Perfection

I rented this dress for a winery tour! So so so beautiful. I ordered a size 6 but it was a bit big, I would have sized down on this one. If you have the chance to rent this dress, DO IT! I felt gorgeous during the whole day. See more pics with this dress on Instagram: @victorialeandra

links_reviews_title: Little Girl thought I was a Princess
links_reviews_text: A little girl was telling her mom, "look there's a princess!!" This is a beautiful dress. My boyfriend thought it was a bit busy. It was probably a little too fancy for work, but I'm over the top like that!
Mother's Day. Absolutely stunning dress. LOVE IT!
Little short waisted on me (5'9") but comfortable and easy to wear with normal bra. Well made, beautiful details!
Loved this dress! Fit was great. I am a tall 5'6 and it wasn't too short for a charity event.

I paired this with a belt to cinch in the wait a tiny bit more. I liked that it came to almost below my knee which I wasn't expecting. The dress comes in two pieces a slip underneath and the net-like piece on top. Got some compliments and would rent again.
I really loved wearing this feminine, comfortable dress. As usual, I wore it with a blazer and boots and tights.
Super fun dress. I felt like it ran big. Super fun colors and great quality. I added a belt and didn't wear the underlining. I added tights and a Lacey bra.

This comes in two pieces - a black slip/underdress and then the piece on top. The top layer is kind of heavy. For a dress of this cut I didn't find it as flattering as I was anticipated. Belting it made it more flattering but it didn't fall exactly right that way either.

As with all dresses with no stretch, I was concerned that this dress would not fit in the bust area, but this dress fit fine, only slightly tight. That said, choose your size based on your bust size- the rest of the dress is very roomy. Pretty and unique, not necessarily flattering but not frumpy either. Worth a rental for sure.
LOVED this dress -- such high quality and design. A bit high waisted, but fixed with a belt so you couldn't tell. Black slip comes on a different hangar -- cue 5 min of thinking I got five items!
This dress is very pretty, the design and pattern in the fabric are beautifully made. It comes with a black slip separate to wear underneath.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous fabric and detail! Lots of compliments
links_reviews_text: Amazingly comfortable

links_reviews_title: This is a beautiful dress. The details are amazing and the colors are vibrant.
links_reviews_text: It's very high-quality, but too tight for me so I never wore it.
This makes your torso look short and fat.

links_reviews_title: Queen if hearts! Got a million compliments on this dress which is elegant and whimsical.
links_reviews_text: Lights out amazing. Wore it to work and out for dinners. It's 2 layers - a slip underneath and then the embroidered part. Loved it. Will rent again.
Loved the dress but fit like a sack. I did not need up wearing it.
This dress is so unique, especially the pattern. It has two layers, a black slip and the outer layer that is kind of like a heavy lace. It's comfortable and looks amazing at the same time.

links_reviews_title: Meh. Not nearly as flattering as I thought it would be.
links_reviews_text: The dress was much longer than expected, mid calf, and I'm 5"8. It flared out from the waist a lot, so didn't give much shape.

links_reviews_title: Perfect for a party in New Orleans!
links_reviews_text: The top of the dress fit my bust/shoulders really well but the waist and hips were loose. I wore it with a thin black belt to give my waist more definition and it looked great. The ribbon/belt shown did not come with the dress. The crocheted style fabric is just beautiful and super expensive looking. Loved this dress!

Love Red Valentino and the fabric was just gorgeous as always. The cut was a little funky on me, hits a little high on the waist so not the most flattering as it does not really give you much of a figure. Cute for work though and fun to try with my unlimited

I loved this dress! It was fun, colorful and a quality item!! I wore this twice before sending back! The first time I topped it with a black leather motorcycle jacket and the second time a jean jacket (because it is still chilly where I live). Both times I received sooo many compliments. The dress was able to be dressed up or worn a little more casual. It was a tiny bit scratchy around the arm, but it was not a deal breaker. The black slip underneath was the perfect size and length.

I didn't totally love this one, but everyone else did! I have never gotten so many compliments at work. It runs TTS (on the shorter side) and is beautifully constructed with an intricate pattern and detail.
true to size, but I should have ordered a size down.
Tight around arms

links_reviews_title: Much more frumpy than I expected
links_reviews_text: The dress arrived with the tags still on. The material is beautiful and you can tell the dress is very high quality. However, I thought it was going to be a lot shorter than it actually is. I'm 5'8" and this dress was all the way to my knees. I was thinking that it would be short enough to wear it with knee high boots. Definitely not. I thought it would be cute and short, good for a fun date night. Instead, I felt very frumpy in it. Maybe for something daytime, or a bridal shower, this would be good. But it's really not flirty the way I hoped it would be. Also, there was no bow belt like in the photos.

links_reviews_title: Cute dress but buttons open a lot!
links_reviews_text: This dress was comfortable but cute for work. I really loved this dress with the exception of the buttons on the bottom opening up a lot.
Love this dress and wish it was available in more colors! So easy to wear and appropriate for work. I love that the fabric is relatively wrinkle-resistant.
I want this dress in multiple patterns. Hello? It has pockets. I gave it a 3 star because the buttons kept popping open on my chest area and the bottom few.

links_reviews_title: Very comfortable and cute! Needed to be steamed but otherwise great dress. Was just missing a button
links_reviews_text: Super comfy and cute - tons of compliments

I ended up wearing this piece to a very casual day-time wedding. It has a boho-chic look to it and is oversized (which I think is purposeful) it can be dressed up with heels and dressed down with a jean jacket! If you're looking for a more true to size fit, I'd size down.

Loved the look and feel of this dress. It was easy to wear, other than the loose buttons--I really had to monitor them throughout the day to make sure they weren't coming undone. A safety pin between button 1 and 2 helped a lot.
The fabric of this dress is amazing, is flows really nice and it's super comfortable
Meh, fit fine, but just was not very memorable. Comfortable and easy to wear though.

links_reviews_title: Worried it would look "grandma-ish" but felt trendy / chic!
links_reviews_text: This runs a little large. I was worried that this would look frumpy / grandma-ish but wa pleasantly surprised that it felt very chic / trendy - I got a lot of compliments at work. I also wore this on a very hot / humid day and it was still very comfortable because the material is light.

I wore this dress to work and while on vacation. The fabric is comfortable, airy, and I liked having pockets. One con—and it was a big one—was how often and randomly the buttons would just open up, and not just a couple, but several of them. I had to put safety pins between the top three buttons just to ensure my chest wasn’t exposed. The sash was confusing—I wanted to center my bow, but it’s sewed on one side, and the sash is asymmetrical lengths, so I had to tie it on the side (no big deal, but just a detail I noticed). I loved the floral print—very feminine, minimalist vibe. I think it’s a great dress for multiple occasions. Apart from having to babysit the buttons, I loved it.

I love this feminine dress by Paper Crown! Running true to size with some stretch, I recommend wearing your true size for your primary size and going up for the back-up. This style is fitted throughout the midsection and straight at the hips. It works for all cup sizes. You are able to wear a standard bra with this dress. At 5'3, the length hit tea length on me.

The dress is pretty. Nothing special about it but a good spring dress for work or a bridal shower perhaps. The buttons were a little loose and they go from top to bottom so I had to be careful all day, but the fit was good and I liked the color and pattern a lot.
I wore this for work on Easter Day. Received a ton of compliments and it was so comfortable! It's even cute Without the belt! I definitely recommend
Cute. Worked for casual work setting. Maybe a little nicer. Definitely seen better days. Might have been worn a few too many times.
This dress is cute and can be dressed up or down. But it ran pretty big, so I wished they'd had an extra small.

links_reviews_title: The buttons suck. Super loose and constantly pop. Would not recco
links_reviews_text: Very cheap

links_reviews_title: Not for the faint of heart!
links_reviews_text: I wore this on a work trip to New York and it was one of the worst outfit experiences I have. This dress has fully functioning buttons all the way down, which makes no sense to me. With pretty much every little move I made at least one button came unbuttoned. At one time I looked down and the three bottom buttons and the two top were all unbuttoned. Made for quite the risqué trade show floor walk. I do not recommend this!!!!
Cute dress, but I'm usually a 4/6 and was swimming in a S! Going to exchange for an XS because I would love to wear it. It's breezy but feels high quality.

links_reviews_title: Really cute dress - Belt not included :(
links_reviews_text: Adorable dress, disappointed it didn't come with the belt as pictured. My little heart was broken when I found that out. The buttons did keep opening up at weird times but that wasn't a huge deal. The belt is pretty necessary to the outfit, but I thankfully had a black and gold belt that paired alright with the dress. I wore the dress to work and to go shopping. Probably won't rent again, but I LOVED the print and the length.
No shape to the dress. Put it on and took it off. Did nothing for me.

This was perfect! Conservative, comfortable, and fashionable. Great for a graduation. Only con was that some of the buttons didn't like to stay buttoned so I monitored them closely throughout the day. Loved the pattern and color of this.

links_reviews_title: Cute dress but a bit mumsy
links_reviews_text: This was a nice dress with a cute print but it just looked a bit too mumsy. Maybe ok for work or a family event but not a fun dress.
This dress ran super large for me and was not complimentary at all.
This dress was a cute pattern but a bit oversized and the belt was really funky. It was sown on one side but not on the other. It made belting the dress really awkward.
Fun, whimsical feeling dress. Seems to run small (I'm normally between a S and M). May rent in a size down for more polished look. All in all, comfy and easy to wear.

I absolutely loved this dress. I felt so chic - it's a mix between modern in vintage in all the right ways. Only issue I had was that the buttons kept coming undone. Wish this was a zipper dress with faux buttons - that would have made all the difference.

links_reviews_title: Great cut, pretty dress for work.
links_reviews_text: Buttons kept coming undone so was good to wear a slip underneath!

links_reviews_title: All the button concerns are true.
links_reviews_text: I kept this dress and wore it twice while on vacation because it's flattering and comfortable. However, all the earlier reviews about the buttons popping open are true. My dress had been pinned at the top by a previous renter and RTR smartly left it there when they sent it to me. I think this dress runs slightly large. I'm a true 6 currently and between S and M but the small fit fine, even in the bust. It might swallow truly petite girls.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful, but I couldn't keep it buttoned!
links_reviews_text: Fantastic dress that I considered buying, but I couldn't keep this buttoned at all! The dress buttons from the top to the bottom in the front, and the buttons were constantly coming undone due to the silkier nature of the fabric.
This dress was not flattering at all, looked frumpy and just not that great. Did not wear.

Fits well and runs just a bit big if you are looking for a more fitted look. Very flattering and I receive several compliments. Fabric is fun. BUT the buttons keep popping open! If you are busty I would not recommend this dress. I was stressful to wear since I always had to be checking the buttons.
Not great for me as I'm large busted.. I think it would have been cute otherwise!

links_reviews_title: Just OK for me- size down!
links_reviews_text: I'm 120 pounds 5'4 and this was super loose on me (especially up top for my fellow small busted ladies). I loved the pattern and material but would definitely be more flattering on more curvy figure

links_reviews_title: I did not wear the dress.
links_reviews_text: I did not care for the color of this dress when it arrived.
This was too loose on me and made me feel a little dowdy so I didn't end up wearing it. I wanted it to work bc the style was cute it just wasn't for me!
I only wish the buttons would stay closed! I was worried all day about a wardrobe malfunction at work. Otherwise, got lots of compliments. If I owned this dress I would just have it sewed shut.

links_reviews_title: Very cute and fit so nicely, but button by crotch was missing...
links_reviews_text: I loved how this dress fit! Especially through the hips, thighs and legs! The only problem was that there was a button missing by the crotch which created a pretty revealing problem. Wish I could have worn it!

Unflattering fit, makes my 5'1" frame look frumpy. Underarm area had extra fabric but shoulders slightly pulled. Couldn't wear this one. The material draped well and would hang nice on a slender tall frame.

links_reviews_title: Lots of fabric, not very flattering
links_reviews_text: I'm 5'4" and this dress may be better on someone taller. It was big and overwhelming for my frame. I ended up not wearing because of that, but again, for someone significantly taller it may be fine.

This was the perfect gown for a New Years wedding! It was a little loose in the hip area (I have no curves, athletic build, 130 lbs, 5'6") but I loved it anyways and was still incredibly flattering. I wore it with 2.5" block heels and the length was perfect. The arm holes got a little irritating toward the end of the night, but I also dance with my arms raised a lot. Loved it anyways and would definitely recommend.

I got this dress as my first choice for a black tie gala. I usually wear a medium/8 and this was a little snug on me in the rib area. The length was perfect for me. I'm 5'3 and I wore flats. Due to the snugness, the dress did rub under my arms a little. I loved it though and got tons of complements!

links_reviews_title: Well-made, beautiful gown and perfect fit.
links_reviews_text: I originally rented this for my daughter's wedding but chose a different dress and regretted it ever since. I rented this a second time to wear to a gala and still regret not wearing it for my daughter's wedding! About the dress: There is no give in this fabric, so don't try to squeeze into it. Also, I have small boobs - a more endowed woman will not do well in this. Strapless or stick-on chicken filets work well. Easy to walk in - TONS of compliments. I wore 3 inch heels with the 10L and probably could've done better with the 10R. I highly recommend this one.

This is the second time I've ordered a "long" Marchesa, only to find it skins the top of my feet. I'm not quite 5'5". Beyond really hoping for floor length, it fit perfectly, hugging my curves. Lots of compliments, felt gorgeous.

I absolutely LOVED this dress! I ordered the size 12 and 14, but only received the 12. Lucky me, it fit perfectly. I had intended on wearing shapewear but it was so hot out I didn't need to. I loved the lacy high neckline because it was modest without being dowdy. The fit was like a slight mermaid, which I've never worn but now think I should more often. It was very easy to sit through a long multi course dinner in and hit the dance floor after.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous dress perfect for a formal event
links_reviews_text: Wore this dress to an Indian wedding and it couldn't have been more perfect. Fits true to size and deceptively comfortable!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful dress for black tie wedding! One of a kind!
links_reviews_text: The dress was absolutely gorgeous. A snug fit but luckily had a VERY sturdy zipper! I was able to wear a black, spaghetti strap body shaper underneath, which was helpful because at 56 years old, without a bra, the dress had a more matronly look. The underlying of the dress is black, so the shaper simply looked like a part of the dress. I felt great in this dress! Note that the floral design, unlike the dress in the website photo, is very much arranged in a horizontal pattern. I am 5'5" , rectangular body type so was a bit worried about the waist being too small, since there is absolutely no stretch to the dress, but it was a perfect fit!

links_reviews_title: Felt like a princess in this dress!
links_reviews_text: The fit was PERFECT! It is snug but hugs all the right places. Compliments, I wore to an indian reception and the Wow's I received! Were well worth it! I didn't have formal indian attire so with the bride's sister blessing I went with this and I was sooo happy with it.
Too tight didnt like the fir

At 20 weeks, I was nervous that this wouldn't fit, I sized up and it did! I wore this for the holiday gala at work and I received so many compliments on the dress alone! Even though I was certainly showing, many people were so focused on the dress that they didn't even realize I was pregnant lol! I felt so glamorous! Definitely recommend!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful dress for black tie wedding in NYC in February
links_reviews_text: This dress was beautiful and fit well in the waist (where I sometimes have issues) as well as top and below. Docked a star because it was a little short for a gown - I'm 5'6 or 5'7" and wore very low heels and I worried it was short. If I rented again, would do the 6L. Lots of compliments on this one and felt comfortable eating and dancing!

I received this item as a backup after my gown was longer available. I choose it last minute, but evened up loving it!! Would rent again. Dress runs short. I am only 5'2 and ordered a long because of reviews. Would rent again !!

links_reviews_title: Light, elegant, and a perfect fit!
links_reviews_text: I wanted a classy and elegant look for a Great Gatsby themed black tie event. This dress proved to be a perfect fit in more ways than one! I am short (4' 11"), thin, but curvy. The 2R fit like a glove. Plus, the cut allowed me to wear a racer back style bra. I find strapless bras very cumbersome, so this was a huge benefit. I looked and felt priceless. I received compliments all night!

links_reviews_title: Wore this beautiful gown to a masquerade party!
links_reviews_text: Fit perfectly to my body shape, and a stunning dress for the occasion!

This dress is absolutely amazing. Pictures truly don’t do it justice. The embroidered gold overlay is elegant without being too flashy but you really can’t see how pretty it is from a photo. My regular size 4 wasn’t available so I wore the backup size 6. It was a little big in the hips but the cut of the dress hid that, and the top was very comfortable (I’m broad shouldered with no hips so I have a tough time fitting into dresses in general). The length was a little long, I had to pick it up when I walked because it kept catching on the crystals on the back of my shoes but not a big deal. I felt like a princess in this dress and received tons of compliments. This one will definitely not disappoint!
Really beautiful dress- was a bit big/long but was pretty forgiving and worked ok with 6 inch heels. Would suggest a petite size if you're on the shorter side.

links_reviews_title: Stunning with beautiful details, runs a little bit small
links_reviews_text: This dress runs a little small. I'm a 8/10, and the 10 fit perfectly. Very comfortable, worn with a strapless black bra. Danced and moved around without a problem. Highly recommend.

Wore this for our Christmas party and I got so many compliments! The arms are cut in a bit which shows that little bit of "arm pit" chub, so be warned. I usually wear a size 10 dress in Calvin Klein and most brands that would be similar. I sized up based on other reviews and I'm glad I did. I wore the size 14L. I'm 5'4" and wore 3" heels. The dress just hit the floor, which I thought was perfect.

links_reviews_title: I love love loved this dress and got so many compliments.
links_reviews_text: It fit perfectly and I received so many compliments. Wore it to a NOLA themed charity ball and it was perfect.

links_reviews_title: It was so easy to rent and return.
links_reviews_text: This dress fit like a glove! I felt so pretty all night and received so many compliments. A little uncomfortable under the arms but nothing terrible.
This dress is beautiful! I have looked everywhere for the perfect dress to wear to my sons wedding and I finally found the look I wanted.

This dress is just as gorgeous in person!! I rented two dresses for this wedding and although I didn't end up wearing this one I still have to say how amazing this dress is!! I'm 5'4" 127lbs and my measurements are 34bust, 28waist, 37hip and the 0L fit amazing in my 4" heals! I like dresses long so your feet don't show (just my personal preference) I could have also don't the regular length but I love length! I also fit in the 2 but the 0 fit like a glove, made me feel glamorous, and hugged all the right places!

links_reviews_title: This dress really shines. It is classy and sophisticated with a touch of flare. Perfect for a ball!
links_reviews_text: The dress was gorgeous. It fit well, and I got lots of compliments. The gold really stands out and makes the dress stunning. I am barely 5'7 which is inbetween the regular and long length and with not super high heels, the long length was perfect. I wore the dress for about 7 hours and at the end of the evening, I had red marks on the front of my shoulders from the dress so that was slightly uncomfortable, but not so much that I would not wear it again if I wanted too.

This dress was for a black-tie wedding. It fit perfectly and was beautifully constructed. The long was a little too long, but I'm not sure if the R would have been enough ... still, it was not a problem. I got tons of compliments!

links_reviews_title: I felt like a total Queen in this gown! Tons of compliment, ideal for Tall/athletic build.
links_reviews_text: 6L would have been perfect, but my hips and rear end refused to comply. Using safety pins I reduced the waist gap in 8L and kept it moving. I think for the average body type, this dress will run true to size. just Fabric feels great on body. Not much stretch in fabric, but I still managed to enjoy a few songs on the dance floor. I'm 5'10 and with my 3.5inch heals, the dress fell perfectly, resting about a 1.4inch from ground. you can get away with wearing straps in this dress, but I recommend going strapless. If I weren't a Graduate Student, and thus broke, I would purchase this dress at once. In case I am not being clear, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND RENTING THIS DRESS.
This was the back up dress I was sent . It was perfect and what I ended up wearing . I had many compliments . Beautiful dress ! I will rent again . Thank you RTR for helping me out .

I love this dress! I've rented the blush and the navy as well and they all fit like a glove! They're a good length with 2.5-3" heels but is okay with flats (getting ready, dancing, etc). Comfortable to sit in, walk in, and dance in! It felt like effortless glamour! Like, I put this dress on and I felt taller and really at my best instantly. I wish this dress came in even more colors, because I would definitely rent those too!!

links_reviews_title: Stunning dress, classic elegance, gold embroidered lace overlay as well! Unique and unforgettable
links_reviews_text: Loved this dress! Very comfortable and easy to dance in, it is incredibly flattering as well! You won't be able to wear a normal bra with it because of the sheer back, but can wear an adhesive bra. I received compliments all night as well and this dress was stunning!
The fit of the dress is amazing!! Very figure flattering and I received MANY compliments. Wish it came in petite For length.

links_reviews_title: The dress was simply fabulous. It looked stunning, elegant, and I received many compliments.
links_reviews_text: This was my first Rent The Runway. I needed an elegant dress for my daughter’s wedding. I am a petite person (5’3, 121 lbs) and ordered size 2 and 4. I could have worn both dresses just fine. Size 4 was a slightly looser fit and a little bit longer. I decided to wear size 2 as it hugged my figure beautifully. The slightly shorter length was perfect, since I was able to wear comfortable shoes with a shorter heal. I wore a strapless bra but a regular bra would have worked as well. I was very happy with my first Rent The Runway experience. The reviews were very helpful during my selection process. I highly recommend this service and will definitely rent again when the occasion arises.

The gown had beautiful gold thread detailing and with the conservative mesh neckline it worked very well for the military ball I attended with my husband. The fit was nice but there is no give in the fabric, so be sure of your size. I'm 5'2" and the R was a little long for me with 2.5" heels. However, the way the dress flows, it is not really noticeable that it is actually too long for you. Was able to sit, stand, and dance the whole night with no irritation under arms and with enough room to move. Received lots of positive compliments on this gown, which was my backup gown! Winner!

links_reviews_title: I got this dress for prom, and it was unlike all the other dresses I saw!
links_reviews_text: Both sizes I tried on and both fit nicely. I preferred the bigger size because it made the lace detailing less itchy. I got so many compliments on this dress and everyone wanted to know where I got it! I am 5ft 5inches and I wore 3 inch heels and the length was perfect for me!

links_reviews_title: i accidentally matched the event colors and theme!
links_reviews_text: length is always most important to me! i wore four inch heels and this dress worked okay -- the black underslip was too short, but the sheer gold overdress hung several inches longer, and at least gave the illusion that the dress was longer than it actually is. if i'd have worn flats, or lower heels, it would have been just fine. the dress was comfortable and fit well everywhere else.
Runs long. Get petite. I'm 4'11 106pds and wore the 2R. Wish I ordered the 0P. Dress was beautiful though, and I just lifted the 'train' while I walked. Wore it to symphony.

This dress was perfect for a formal event and I received so many compliments! I wore the size 2 although it felt a little tight around the arm holes by the end of the night. The size 4 allowed for some more room but the waist area was a little baggy so I opted for the size 2.
Loved this dress for the Mayor's Ball!

Rented for a wedding as a backup dress when my original choice became unavailable and loved it! I wore it to a black tie optional wedding. I wore a 0R and it fit true to size. It was a little long with 4" heels on, but I think the 0P might have been a little too tight on the hips so I was happy with the regular. Would definitely recommend, the detailing is gorgeous! Very pretty and classy dress!

So glad I ordered the 8L! It was perfect with 3 inch heels. The 8R was a bit too short for me even standing barefoot. For the older ladies here’s some good info: I wore a nude colored, size 36D bustier for support. The color wouldn’t have mattered as it didn’t show anywhere at all. It was perfect! Hope this information helps.

I typically wear a size 2-4 depending on the dress. I definitely needed the size 4 for it to fit through the bust. I am a 32DD. The length was great for me but I'm 5'5" and was surprised the dress wasn't longer. I would encourage anyone 5'6" or taller to select the long length. It was a perfect dress for the formal I attended.
The fit was true to size, i wore a 2 inch heel and it was perfect.

Another great garment from Kate Spade! I felt it ran a tad bit large and plan to order a 6 next time to see if it 's a better fit. The skirt part was a little big. It is a bit time consuming to go to the bathroom, but well worth it. Just be proactive and don't wait until it's an emergency. Will definitely rent this again and may purchase it it the 6 fits better.

I was looking for outfits for work and for my Oktoberfest-themed couples' bridal shower. This look was flattering and comfortable. I ended up wearing it for brunch with family the next day, not for the shower. It is quite the pickle getting in and out of it, but a quality style on which I got many compliments. Wore it with red Michael Kors pumped and #nailedit.

This is a perfect jumper. Yes, it's a skort. You can handle it. A long torso is not a problem. My only small fuss is that you can see the white zipper on side of the black bottom. Best paired with a print shoe.

links_reviews_title: Great for anything from work to a night out
links_reviews_text: I got so many compliments on this outfit. It was long enough that I could still wear it for work (in a conservative office), yet still felt cute and stylish when worn with a statement necklace. People told me I should've purchased it. The only thing that kept me from doing so was that it was a pain using the restroom. I had to zip down the side and button down the front each time. Some rompers are easier - though some are definitely harder too. I'll likely rent it again!

I hated to have to give this lovely romper 3 stars, but I had no choice. The material and fit are really nice (runs a little small if you're on the curvier side or have boobs) but getting in and out of this romper is literally a nightmare it's not functional at all so you would not want to wear this and have to go to the bathroom more than once
Great fabric and look. Works great for a large bust. Only pain point is using the ladies room, but totally worth it.

Once again I can credit this RTR outfit to my husband who selected it. He's aware of my Kate Spade obsession so he thought this was a solid choice. What he forgot to factor in is that I'm a stay-at-home mom & this outfit would be much better suited in a professional atmosphere. Also- let's admit wearing rompers is inconvenient if you need to use the restroom. Classy outfit that I paired with black & white peep toe heels.stackable pear

I really liked this romper. It's classic, well made, and the fabric was very nice (silkier top with thicker, sturdier bottom). But it's a romper so I decided not to wear it to work and wore it to brunch (chose shorter event so that using the bathroom would not be necessary). It was very hard to get into the romper since the top is one piece. I had to pull the bottom up so far in order to get my head through the neck hole (still wondering if I missed a secret snap/zipper that would have made getting in and out easier!). If it weren't so hard to get this on, I would have kept it longer. I am a little short waisted so the top was a little loose but overall it fit true to Kate Spade size (always a little snug on me). The weather was a little cool so I wore tights and a leather jacket with it.
Really flattering piece, but if you've got a big butt it'll ride up occasionally. My SO was on butt patrol all day tugging it down.

links_reviews_title: Fit fine, but I looked like a waiter. Sending it back -- I wanted to wear this to a formal event.
links_reviews_text: [required field]

This was cute but not really for me. They didn’t have my size, so I ordered a size up, which is probably the reason it didn’t look that great. It’s obviously best to get your own size, but if you can’t, then size down rather than up!
AMAZING!!!!
Super cute but too small. Didn't wear

Cute outfit I just needs to use fashion tape to seal the gaps in between the button on the top breast area. The top white half looked slightly more yellow or off white then a pressed clean white. Still I would ware it again

links_reviews_title: cute romper; wore well. difficult zipper
links_reviews_text: it fit well and looks very cute. Top is a pretty see through so choose under garments accordingly. only con was the zipper was very difficult & got stuck frequently
Too difficult to get on and off so I did not wear it. You'd never be able to go to the bathroom!
Absolutely loved it. The size is great. It's not too short. Wore it for dinner date and a day time brewery hopping. Looked dressed up but casual enough for day time too.

Cute classic Kate spade piece. Keep in mind that this is a skort! Get into it! It was cute but ran a little big. I ended up adding a belt to create a waistline but overall a solid piece. Oh I'm 5'11 btw and it stopped mid thigh
This is super cute. Tons of compliments. Fits true to size. I didn't think it was too short for work.

links_reviews_title: The zipper is the worst--do not rent this
links_reviews_text: I read reviews that said the zipper is bad but I still rented it because it was so cute and Kate Spade couldn't put out crap right? You cannot get this zipper up and down yourself. I had to leave the bathroom and go find someone to help me get dressed again. Would not recommend renting this at all! The actual romper is so if you don't ever pee this might be the romper for you

This was a great outfit...once I was able to get it on. The zipper was EXTREMELY difficult to get up over the two different fabrics. It fit perfectly once it was on, but could not get the zipper past the one area without help.

links_reviews_title: I couldn't wear it because it was to tight in the bust
links_reviews_text: Very cute and a good fit everywhere except the bust.

links_reviews_title: A little snug - blouse was poofy
links_reviews_text: I usually wear a 10/12. I ordered the 12 and it was a big snug. My main issue was that the blouse portion was a bit poofy, not trim like in the photo. Then the buttons did that boob gap thing that isn't really attractive. My 6 year old vetoed the dress, so I returned it.
This looks adorable in the photo, the dress we got looked a little worse for the wear. the top is not white and is really blousy. I think that it would be good for a large busted person.

links_reviews_title: I used this for a family portrait.
links_reviews_text: It was WONDERFUL! I want to buy it for keeps.

I did not wear this after I rented a 10 and 12. The zipper was fidgety on both sizes by the waist. I'm sure the 12 waist would have fit me after some force, but I didn't want to break it, and then the top part on the 12 was too big for me. I think this is super cute, but it would look better on a slim, lean person.

links_reviews_title: I didn't get to wear it
links_reviews_text: It's too small

I had my eye on this item since I saw it. It wasn't available in my size initially, so I waited and rented it next time around. It arrived, fit beautifully, was super flattering, and very chic. Then came the bad news. This thing is the WORST to get in and out of. There is a long zipper on the side that constantly gets snagged on the fabric (no, it was not too small, it fit perfectly and slightly loose). Then when you get through that there are literally allll buttons down the front. SO basically, wore this, felt unstoppable, until I had to pee, which legitimately had me in the bathroom at the office for a solid 30 minutes. Would've bought it hands down if it was a bit more 'user friendly'.

links_reviews_title: It was actually a kind of forgettable event...
links_reviews_text: Comfortable and flattering.
There are definitely challenges to get this off, but it's really cute and worth it in my opinion.
I tried a size 4 which was too small up top & baggy on bottom. A 6 would've solved the top issue, but not the bottom... not for me, obviously
Wore this to work. Super cute, fit perfectly. I'm a size 2- 5'7", 125 lbs, slim athletic build. Super flattering and got tons of compliments. Looked great with black heels.
I found the blouse portion too sheer, but there wasn't enough room to add a camisole, so I didn't wear it.
Fit was true to size - the zipper was a bit wonky and was very difficult to get in and out, which is risky at work functions. Worked great for a few short meetings, but not a full day of work.

The romper was beautiful but ran small. I called and they didn't have a bigger size so I couldn't wear it. Small in the waist. If you have a small chest, would work. Shirt gaped with c cup. I needed a 10. Size up.
I felt that the shorts/skirt was much too long simply from a proportion standpoint.

Very Kate Spade. I paired with a leather jacket, black tights and red clogs. Cute look. The size 8 top juuust fit me. Keep in mind if you are on the busty side. Overall, I'd recommend if you're looking for something cute/fun. I wish I'd snapped a photo.

Wore this to a friend's baby shower in September - fit was perfect, the shorts weren't too tight for my muscular thighs, and the top was the perfect amount of subtle sexiness and completely still covered/appropriate. Wouldn't hesitate to rent this again! Only issue was the stitching around the waist needs to be reinforced. And of course bathroom breaks were annoying since it's a one-piece.

links_reviews_title: Good for work to happy hour
links_reviews_text: Super cute and fun!

I really loved this romper. So very Kate Spade. Classy and long enough to be work appropriate. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars was that the zipper was awfully hard to get up and down which made bathroom breaks cumbersome.
As other reviewers mentioned, this is short which is perfect for my height. Love the lightweight fabric for summer. Sleeves are flattering without being overwhelming on my petite frame.
Perfect causal comfortable weekend dress! The ruffles are amazing!

I rented this for a casual work function but I couldn't wear this even on a date night. It was so short it barely covered my butt. Too bad because it would otherwise be so cute. Size up if you're shorter and want to try it.

This dress is so cute and comfortable. The body is soft cotton, and the sleeves are a little more firm with a zig-zag of red thread at near the seams. I'm 7 months pregnant, so I feel like my belly made the dress fit shorter than it normally would have - a common problem at my stage. Loved it still.
This dress runs very small, and if you have a booty, forget about it! The dress was very short on me and I'm just 5'3".
This dress was so short I could not wear it. I did not wear with pants either because it would have looked like a baggy t-shirt.
Despite ordering a size up, this dress was too short for me to wear out in public.

links_reviews_title: Great quality and I love a ruffle sleeve but the fit was not right
links_reviews_text: Great quality and I love a ruffle sleeve but the fit was not right. Too short, better worn as a top with cropped skinny jeans

I'm just shy of 5'7 and found this to be way too short. I'm OK with showing some leg but I felt like I wouldn't be able to lift my arms in this dress. Another note is the seam on the sleeves is red. The detail is cute but if you are looking for pure white then you might want to pass. Lastly, the material is basically teeshirt material so this is super casual.

this is strange - I'm 5'8" so i ordered the large - it wasn't tight but SO SHORT. booty VERY out and not work appropriate or anything appropriate. i might try wearing it as a tunic for a chill weekend but yeah - NOT a dress. weird but i guess if you're shorter it might work but still probably get the large
Laughable short. I'm 5'4 and sized up because previous reviews stated it ran small. It was not tight, but barely went past my butt. Sizing is definitely off.

I ignored the other reviews about this dress being short because at 5'0", I rarely experience that issue with dresses. However, this barely covered my private are and would have completely exposed me if I tried to bend over or sit.
The fit was perfect but definitely not appropriate to wear for work. 100% keeping it for a weekend in the Hamptons

links_reviews_title: This is a tunic, NOT a dress
links_reviews_text: There is no way this could have been worn as a dress. It was way too short, and needs to be worn more as a tunic. You would've had to add another 6 inches for it to be a short mini dress.

I originally rented an XS but switched to a S because of other reviews. The S fit in the shoulder but the length was four inches above my knees and I'm only 5'1". I was thinking about wearing it as a tunic but decided that it's kind of ridiculous. I think a L would have fit.
Very cute and I liked the sleeves, but as other reviews said it is SUPER short. I am barely 5'2 and almost couldn't wear it so short
The dress is T-shirt material, very short. Thought about wearing as a shirt. Did not wear

links_reviews_title: Casual Friday look. Lots of compliments. Hangs well on a petite frame.
links_reviews_text: Cannot have a large chest to wear.
This was a small T-shirt dress that was sheer and not flattering. It barely covered my private areas.

It was very cute and a comfortable cotton (?) material but oh boy, it was short short short ! I really could not bend over in it at all. It might have been better if I had sized up to a S but the rest of it fit fine though it is not a fitted dress so I guess it wouldn't have mattered so much. The sleeves were so puffy that it would have been hard to fit a coat over it and even having a shoulder bag was a bit of a challenge.
The sleeves were overwhelming for someone as petite as me.

links_reviews_title: Cute, but way too short, hello booty
links_reviews_text: Got this for everyday summer wear, about 7 months pregnant and looked so comfy. Fits great everywhere except the length. Way too short, and i like short dresses. Rented a large in hopes it'd be longer after reading reviews... still too short. I'm 5'5, long-ish torso.
Love this super cute dress but it's very short.
Loved the ruffle sleeves but this dress was way too short for me. I'm 5'9" and the dress hit right under my bottom. Would be cute on someone shorter!
Way too short...and I'm 5'4"
The dress was super short and is much more form fitting than it appears in the picture. The red in the sleeves is also much more prominent.

links_reviews_title: Very comfortable. Body of dress is more casual than it appears in pictures.
links_reviews_text: Cute!
This dress is really short! I could not wear it. I am 5'5" and it was the length of a long top.
Very short!
The dress was fitted but it needed to be much longer. I'm 5'1" and it barely covered my butt.

I wore this once for a lunch. It was a cute beginning-of-second-trimester dress. My bump is beginning to show so the dress did not fit for much longer! Would be perfect for someone who is not pregnant. I thought the material was a bit thick and I did not love that, but the style is cute.

links_reviews_title: First thing I sent back without wearing
links_reviews_text: So short it looked silly with the ruffles
While it's way too short to be a dress on me, I was a great top to wear with tights and jeans. The cut was a bit boxy but otherwise it was a fun article of clothing.
Fits like a T-shirt dress with fluttery sleeves. Good if your thin, not so good if you have curves like me.

links_reviews_title: The XL was too short (I'm only 5'3)
links_reviews_text: Runs small

Con- Way too short for me (5'8" and 135lbs.), my rear was hanging out. Probably best suited for someone shorter. Precious dress but I didn't get to wear it bc it was inappropriate. Pro- Precious dress, sleeves are gorgous and nicely made.
Super cute and fun casual look. It is short but I liked it that way. I wore as a dress and as a top over jeans. I liked it as a dress best!

links_reviews_title: Such a cute dress and I liked the style and materials. However, it was too short.
links_reviews_text: The dress was too short, so I was unable to wear it as planned. I am 5'6".

I so wanted this to be cute and fit me, but unfortunately it didn't. It was just way too short to leave the house in. As others have said in their reviews, this would be better suited as a tunic or bathing suit cover up.

I got a medium, which is what I normally expect in dresses since I am bigger in the hips/butt. This dress was still a little too tight in that area though. This made it much too short for me to feel comfortable wearing. I wore out once but felt like I had to be careful when sitting or any time I had to bend over. Made of t-shirt material, so it is also a bit more casual than I pictured.

What can I say? Literally everything by Nicholas the Label is a home fun for me. They just make such well-fitting dresses. The people behind the Label know how to fit a dress for a woman. This dress is exactly that: a perfectly fitted dress. Love it!

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous print, just beware the split at the front when walking
links_reviews_text: Beautiful dress. I liked it more than other Nicholas items I've rented. Had to wear a black cami underneath to make it work appropriate and held it together when walking as the front slit was pretty revealing on me. Paired for work with pointy black flats (not shown in pic).
Wore this dress at a food festival! The light fabric was perfect for the weather and the fit was flattering and comfortable, though it ran a little small.

I love the style of this dress and it's very comfortable except for the part where I feel like I could have a wardrobe malfunction at any moment! When I received the dress it had a seam in the loops. Its former renter had actually very poorly sewn the loops together to keep it closed (you may be able to see in the photo). I could see why they wanted to close the front up a bit. I wish the buttons went up further. I didn't end up wearing this one (it was my back up) but if I had the right event I may rent it again.

links_reviews_title: Wishing this was in my closet always...
links_reviews_text: I'm about 5'3", 125/130 lbs and 32C. I could have used one additional button up top, but otherwise this dress was a DREAM! I used a little tape to keep the bust from showing too much. It's elegant, not too formal and breathable. A must have for a date, afternoon wedding, rehearsal dinner or work. Anything really. It's gorgeous.

links_reviews_title: Great dress for early summer wedding!
links_reviews_text: Dress fit perfectly and was exactly what I was looking for to wear to this event. The top portion of where it buttoned had slight separation where you could see through, but it wasn't too obvious. Would definitely rent again!

I loved the fit of this dress. The fabric felt so high quality and I loved the way it fit and flowed. It is low cut, making it impossible for me to wear a bra. I wasn't worried about any slippage though, because of the fitted bodice. Gorgeous dress! Very sexy and feminine.

Pretty dress, may run slightly big, but I think it's more that the skirt has a lot of fabric since the buttons fit just right. It is very low cut, but I like that look with a lace bandeau bra so it worked well for me. It is all buttons (no zipper) so have patience. Also since it's silk have silk safe static spray on hand. All in all I got some nice compliments.

I wore this dress for a baby shower. Received a ton of complements. This dress is very low cut and with a 34DD it definitely made the dress sexier. If revealing your cleavage makes you uncomfortable you could absolutely wear a lace bralet under. Would absolutely rent again

links_reviews_title: Sexy, yet in a romantic way
links_reviews_text: I absolutely love this dress. I'm actually budgeting out purchasing it next month because I love it so much. The print is gorgeous - you don't see tulips on many clothing items which is a shame because tulips are just beautiful! It literally feels like you are wearing nothing, it is so comfortable which is great and needed if you suffer from any pain condition that makes your skin super sensitive. It is very low cut, so make sure you wear a slip or a lace bralette under it. It doesn't look that good with a tank top unless said tank top is lace or silk-y material. I tried a cotton tank top under it at first, and it made the entire look very cheap, but once I switched to a lace bralette, it was perfect. I put in a picture with the bralette to show how that looks because it seriously made all the difference! I've also worn it sans any coverup on my chest and it looked very sexy- a perfect look for date night or if you're doing an engagement photoshoot and want a little sexiness to it without going over the top but for every day wear, definitely a cover is needed if you are above a b-cup! Really beautiful dress, super pleased that I rented it and can't wait to buy it!
only complaint was that it was kind of staticy and clung to my skin
Nice, quality fabric. However, wasn't that flattering for me as a 32DD at 5'3". Would be great on someone long and lean with a small chest!

I really love this dress. Yes there are a lot of buttons. So you deal with them when you take it on and off and then forget about it. That's the price of style/fashion. The zero fit me very well, even though my coworker said it looked huge on me. I think because of the sleeves. My other coworker said I looked like a Samurai warrior and I have no idea what that was about but again I look to the sleeves. Later when I wore it to a work luncheon a stranger stopped me on my walk and exclaimed, "I love your dress!" So people who get it will get it and otherwise you may field some comments depending on how much the people around you think you need their opinion. But I digress. Gorgeous dress. Great fit. I would definitely recommend and will be renting/ordering again.

links_reviews_title: Easy to wear; Details make the dress
links_reviews_text: This dress is easy to wear. It's a great length with a fun front slit. The v-neck has elaborate trim, with delicate buttons on the front of the dress. The flowers are vibrant colors, and the ties allow for tightening the waist as needed. The dress does run a bit large, and the v-neck was quite deep.

Dress has lots of buttons, no zips - takes time to get into! Very detail oriented with beautiful waistline. Low cut. I wore without a bra because with the bra it was just BAM. it's quite long with big sleeves but the low cut front and middle front slit allows this dress to be fun and not frumpy. Loved.
I LOVED this dress. Your skin will show through the buttons on the top, but I didn't mind. The sleeves were very flowy and perfect for a day in Napa

links_reviews_title: I wanted to keep this dress
links_reviews_text: This dress was perfect for work. Super comfortable and cute. The material is light for summer. The only annoying thing were the buttons...sometimes they came undone. I wore a slip under it since the bust is low cut, but you don't have to if it's not for work.

I absolutely adore this dress. The button details are delicate and beautiful, the print is gorgeous, the silk is sturdy and the dress just flows so beautifully when you walk. You definitely have to wear a cami underneath, but I'm thinking of buying a bandeau just to go under this. Totally in love and as of right now I plan on buying it!

Seriously perfect. Photographs so well. So comfortable and flattering. The flowiness and subdued print really made for gorgeous, outdoor, rustic photos. In love. Pretty low so I ended up wearing a black bralette underneath that worked well.
Great dress for a summers evening. However there is a very long split at the front of the dress. I liked how low cut the front is (I don't have particularly big boobs so it doesn't look too much).
Great material, breathable even in summer heat and humidity. The neckline is a very low V.

Beautiful dress but too low cut for work and also lots of effort to get in and out of it because of all the little buttons. Might be nice for a more formal occasion sans bra, but I intended to wear it for work and it didn't fit my petite/curvy body.
Baggier fit, silky fabric, can wear to work with a cami underneath or casual around town. Very flowery and fun for summer.
I wore this for a party and I felt so beautiful! It did wrinkle on the way there so I brought my steamer. It is very low cut so it's not for the faint of heart.

This dress was very beautiful and flattering. The silk and printed fabric is beautiful. I'm a bit large chested so I ended up wearing a lace slip underneath. The lace was visible at the front neck opening and it still looked great with the dress. I got many compliments. I wore it to a luau rehearsal dinner in Hawaii.

This is a perfect workday dress. I wore it to an event and received compliments on it all day. It feels like you're wrapped in silk!! You can't tell from the model but if has a slit in the front that starts above the knee. It shows a little bit of leg when you're walking but overall it's still conservative. I also layered it with a tank top. The print is beautiful and fresh. I gave it 4 stars because it wrinkles easily when you're sitting down but that's not a big deal..just steam it before you wear it again!

This dress was so beauitful on!!! Sadly, I did not get any flattering photos of it. The floral pattern and ruffly sleeves are so feminine, the silky fabric was so soft and lightweight, and the tie back emphasizes and minimizes the waist perfectly. The neckline is surprisingly low, giving it an unexpectedly sexy feel, but you can solve that with a neutral cami for work. I wore this dress three times in the month I had it and was so sad to return it. Will definitely rent again!
It's beautiful. Sophisticated and flirty at the same time. Will most likely buy this one, I loved it so much.
I fell in love with the dress and wish I wore it more than once! I wore it to work. It fit perfectly and falls nicely over curves.
I normally wear a 6 but I ordered this dress in a 2 because it was the only size available. It worked ok. I just wasnt able to button it all the way up so i wore a bodysuit underneath.

You must wear a slip underneath because the holes from the buttons can show some skin. The chest is really low cut so it's not ideal for someone with a large chest because the dress doesn't give support. However, both of these issues can be solved with wearing a slip underneath! Overall, this dress made me feel whimsical and feminine plus it was super comfy!

links_reviews_title: Relaxed, cute but also low cut
links_reviews_text: Nice silky material. It did wrinkle throughout the day. Loved the neckline details, but the cut was really low for everyday. I ended up wearing a shirt underneath to cover the ladies. Material did not stretch but had a roomy fit.
I received a ton of compliments on this dress, and I felt beautiful. Slightly thin, so not ideal for cooler weather.

i find that Nicholas runs small as a brand but i'm glad i did the 2 in this dress because the 4 would have been WAY too big. this dress is VERY low cut, i should have worn a tank underneath but didn't and it was a little scandalous for work. if you are in between sizes, go with the smaller! (for reference, i am 5'6, 125 lbs, 34B, fluctuate between 2-4 or s/m)
Thought it ran a little big. Probably not the best neckline for someone who is larger chested unless you wanted to wear a shirt underneath.
Perfect casual dress.
Runs a little big. Could have gone a size down. Super cute material and cut.
Very low cut and very high front slit
This dress is gorgeous! A camisole is needed if you are a bit bigger in the front, but loved the way I looked in this dress. If you normally don’t wear florals, this is a great “gateway” dress!

It is very low cut. Very very low cut. But I safety pin and some double sided tape helped keep the girl hidden for the day. I absolutely loved this dress otherwise. It has a nice slit, that fabric is soft and comfortable on a hot day in North Carolina beach humidity. The sleeves are flowy and the pattern is so pretty.
Highly recommended for beach wedding or summer activities. I am 5'9, this dress was longer, (I ordered 12L) and it was perfect. I did clip the straps at the back to secure my front cleavage.

I got this as an option for a wedding and I loved the dress but it was too summery for the March wedding and the leg slit too high since it was an orthodox Jewish wedding. But it was so comfortable and the fit was great. I loved it and wish I had an excuse to wear it. The chest is very flattering for smaller busts like myself.

links_reviews_title: Absolutely stunning dress but petite women beware!
links_reviews_text: I absolutely LOVED this dress! As soon as I tried it, I felt transformed! It's a beautiful color and pattern made from a wonderful silky material. Words of caution though: if you get the petite size, it's still very long. I wore 4-inch heels and was still tripping over it at times. Also if you aren't busty, then fashion tape is an absolute must! Even with those two things, still would rent this dress again in a heartbeat! It's a showstopper.

This dress was excellent. It did require a lot of tape to hold the girls/dress in place since I'm larger in the bust, but it worked out well. It's a light material but well structured so it holds up well. The slit runs high so be mindful of that!
I brought this dress for date night on vacation and wound up wearing it so much more. The fabric is very light and soft. The top and side skit made this dress very sexy. I loved it!

links_reviews_title: Great dress. Very low cut. Thin material
links_reviews_text: I thought the color and the style were impeccable! I wished the material wasn't so thin, because it did rip a little bit. But for a beach wedding or someplace very warm this would be great! I put a Cami underneath it because it's very low-cut
This dress was gorgeous. The 4 fit perfectly and it was comfortable. Definitely a lot of cleavage but it didn't need a bra and it stayed in place pretty well. I wish I could keep it!

links_reviews_title: Breezy, comfortable, but oof that top is low cut...
links_reviews_text: Dress fit true to size, though I maybe could have gone down to a 2L to improve the fit at my bust. Breezy, comfortable, drapes nicely, and pattern is lovely and unique. Plenty of length, worn with 2.5" heels. The only issue is the bust. It's extremely low cut. It hugs nicely enough that I didn't worry about escapage, but it was too visibly low to feel comfortable or appropriate. I ended up pinning the straps in back to get the bust where I needed it to be, which had me concerned about breaking said straps. It was manageable, but concerning. The dress was pretty enough to be worth the effort. It's also a great crossover dress: the wedding I attended was in between summer and fall, on a Sunday, formal attire - a tricky bill, and it fit it!

So comfy. Loved the silky feel. I have small boobs and a large rib cage (36B) so I wasn't sure about this but ended up LOVING it. I did put a safety pin in because if I was slouched at ALL I was worried the straps would fall. Other than that, perfect. Looking for similar dresses for upcoming weddings!

links_reviews_title: I felt so great in this dress!
links_reviews_text: I LOVED this dress! I did not want to part with it after my event. I received tons of compliments. It fit true to size, was very comfortable, and the slit was just enough to feel sexy but not over the top. I have a larger chest, but I loaded up on double sided tape and I was able to dance the night away and the dress stayed perfect all night long. For those wondering, (like I was) the floral pattern is navy, not black, but it's so hard to tell the difference so I got away with wearing black heels and black earrings and it was fine!

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous but a little high maintenance
links_reviews_text: The length of the 2P was still a bit long and I needed 3-4inch heels (I'm 5'5") and really wish the straps were adjustable. You definitely need good posture for this one to make sure straps don't slip and everything stays in place.
The dress is so beautiful and really stands out in a crowd. Definitely need some boob tape to keep things in place but if you are a c cup or below rent this dress. Compliments galore

I had a good feeling about this dress because I'd seen a number of reviews and everyone looked great! I was even happier with the decision than I thought I'd be! I'm pretty flat chested so I had to be careful about the low cut style, but other than that it fit perfectly!
I absolutely loved this dress and was sad to send it back. The material and print is so beautiful and I had lots of people stop me to compliment the dress. Loved it!

links_reviews_title: Wore this for my vow renewal and loved it. Beautiful, easy to wear and made the event feel special.
links_reviews_text: Fits true to size, maybe slightly long. I am 5'7" 130lbs and ordered a 4L but wish I'd done a regular 4.

Absolutely gorgeous dress. I knew it was beautiful, but every time I turned around I had someone compliment the dress! Even my boyfriend noticed that everyone was commenting on the dress and asking where I got it. I have a small chest which made the low cut design look chic and classy without looking like I was "hanging out" of the top. The dress fit like a glove at first but did loosen up a bit as the night went on. I never needed to tie the straps up but I did bring safety pins just in case. All you need is some fashion tape and you can enjoy the freedom of not wearing a bra :) please let me buy this dress, RTR!!

Loved the low cut and slit. The pattern is so pretty and summery. The fabric is light enough for a hot summer night. I absolutely loved it. I do recommend wearing some double sided tape to prevent the top from gaping open. Gorgeous rent!

This dress has a beautiful yellow print in a silky fabric, but unfortunately I was not able to wear it because was large in the chest area, and I'm a 34C. If the straps had been adjustable, maybe it would have fit perfectly.

Absolutely LOVED this dress! Wore this for a summer wedding in Denver, and besides spending a good amount in the bathroom taping in the girls, this dress was perfect!! It's a little long so be careful walking up stairs.

This dress was one of my favorites that I have ordered from RTR and just in general! I wore this to a summer wedding and it was perfect. The fabric is super soft and silky. It is a little long so you will definitely need a high heel shoe. Highly recommend this dress!!

Contrary to other reviews, I had no issues with fit on top. I felt secure in the dress all night, however it is a very deep neckline. The length was good with a two inch heel. I’m giving it 4 stars because the garment I received looked like it had been temporarily hemmed and had a line of adhesive that was visible and couldn’t be removed. I’m 5’7”, 120 lbs.

Glamorous and Comfortable! I love the unique color and pattern as well as the way it flattered my body type! The reviews about the open top are true so if you’re busty it might be a little awkward. I’m a 34C and was able to wear it braless without any slipping or overexposure. Sad to see this hit go!

I love this dress! Very flattering, very sexy and very cool for a summer wedding. I wasn't hot or uncomfortable. I received many compliments, especially from my husband. The straps were a little long and exposed too much cleavage so I made it a halter top by clipping it behind my neck with an earring.

Straps were loose and if you aren't that busty I wouldn't recommend since I was worried about a slip up the entire day. Otherwise, this dress is absolutely gorgeous....if you want heads to turn they will! Just be prepared to show some skin!

This dress was great! The material is soft and light, it was perfect for a summer wedding. The only thing I'd note was that it was pretty revealing in the chest- I tried to use fashion tape to keep things under wraps.
Love this dress! Absolutely perfect!

links_reviews_title: Perfect for summer but holy cleavage!
links_reviews_text: I would have preferred the 2P but it was pretty tight in the rib cage so I went with the 4R. It was super long for me (I'm only 5ft tall). The chest is crazy low and open. Much more so than I was realizing from the review pictures. I ended up wearing a bandeau bra and it looked fine. It would not have been appropriate for a wedding otherwise.

links_reviews_title: This dress was gorgeous loved the quality, material, and color.
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress for a summer wedding. I received a ton of compliments and felt beautiful- only two complaints were that it runs a little long even with high heels and also a little revealing for my taste in the breast area. I used fashion tape to ensure no wardrobe malfunctions, but would’ve felt more comfortable if the breast area was more secure and not so low cut. In addition I’m a 34 C and filled out this area- would not suggest if you’re smaller breasted.

Fit was great for someone with a small bust -- definitely tighter on top which flattering and made everything feel secure. Flowy through the hips and a slit for great movement and easy dancing! Straps were a little long but it wasn't an issue. One of my top three favorite rentals to date!

links_reviews_title: It was delivered when it said that it would be! True to size!
links_reviews_text: True to size. Extremely comfortable and easy to move in. Got so many compliments!

The fit was perfect, but I'm 5'6 and it was just long enough when i had 4 inch heels on. Overall, loved this dress! Received so many compliments and comments about how unique it was. The silk material is absolutely gorgeous, and it shows up super pretty when photographed. Overall, perfect!!

links_reviews_title: Great night full of dancing and laughing!
links_reviews_text: This dress was a last minute overnight shipment after I found out my original dress was not going to make it on time for the wedding we were going to. I have to give credit to RTR customer service for making it happen! Like other ladies said; the neckline was very very open. I had to tie it it the back to hold it together. Other than that it fit perfect, I was able to wear heels and it was exactly the right length.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous dress but huge in bust
links_reviews_text: Absolutely loved this dress but required quite a bit of pinning in the bust. Other than that great fit and flattering, silky fabric

Beautifully made dress, feels like silk. Wore to a wedding in Palm Desert and it was 95 degrees. Never felt overheated in it. Straps were a tad too long so I had to use one of those back bra clips which made it more of a halter type dress. As stated in other reviews, this dress is very very open in the chest area. My 38D "girls" were prominently displayed which wasn't the most appropriate for a wedding. I used a small safety pin in front which helped cover my cleavage a bit - but not much. The semi hidden leg slit is high! Goes to top of thigh. When I sat down my entire thigh showed. The best thing about this dress is it hid my tummy/pooch very well. I didn't need to wear spanx. Long story short, I felt beautiful and got lots of compliments, but I just don't think this is a totally appropriate dress for a wedding since it was so revealing.

The slight is slightly high when you sit down, and the dress runs long. wore a lower heel which had me holding the dress up at some points throughout the evening. Usually a 4, and would recommend getting true to size with this. Had to wear the backup 2 because the 4 arrived damaged but still worked!!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful stunning dress! Soft and comfortable to wear for a warm weather setting!
links_reviews_text: Fits perfect from waist down, however the cleavage is deep and might make you a little self concious. The straps are long and needed adjustment with safety pins to stay secure.

I absolutely loved this dress! It is so beautiful and I got a lot of compliments through out the night. The straps were a bit long so I ended up using a safety pin to hold them together up top which actually ended up making the bust of the dress fit better as well. That's the only reason I gave this a 4/5. I brought fashion tape for the front just in case, but once the straps were pinned I didn't need it. The slit is a little high for windy days but I felt so beautiful in this dress and am so glad I rented it!

links_reviews_title: Perfect gown for a spring wedding in wine country! Loved the unique color and gorgeous fabric!
links_reviews_text: After reading reviews, I was worried that this dress would be long on me (I'm 5'4"), but it was perfect with 3" heels and honestly not too bad when I switched to flip flops at the end of the night. The slit was high but it worked and gave the gown a more flowy quality, which i loved. The top was a bit loose and showed a little more cleavage than I was comfortable with, but I wore a lace strapless bralette underneath, and it was perfect. I got lots of compliments throughout the night and overall felt gorgeous!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful and got so many compliments!
links_reviews_text: have a small chest (32 B),and I had to tape it to keep it up all night. If you are larger than a small C I would size up because of the fit of the gown. If you are smaller with a larger bust I would avoid this dress. It was so pretty and I got many compliments. The 2L dress hit perfect for my 5'7 height (3.5 inch heels), if you're taller than that it may hit you an awkward spot with standard heels on.
Easy breezey, great for spring weather. At 5'5 it was perfect length with a baby heel

links_reviews_title: Wore it for my 30th birthday and loved it!
links_reviews_text: I'm typically a small, but I really loved the dress and have put on a few winter pounds so I ordered the medium as a backup size. The small fit perfectly except literally EVERYTHING was hanging out the backside. It truly felt like someone had hemmed it to an XS length. I ended up going with the medium even though it was a little bigger in the body area. Thick material so it wasn't scratchy at all. The back is a little open so harder to wear with a bra, but it worked out. I loved it. I did wear Spanx though even in the medium... it was a little too huggy (although felt loose) on my tummy and we were having pizza for dinner.
This dress was a hit! Stunning and fun.

I rented this dress for my sororities bid day which was disco themed and LOVED it!! One thing to note is that it is a bit short but thankfully it's more fitted so it wasn't an issue. I'm 5'5 and 130 for reference! Would definitely rent again!

links_reviews_title: Happy New Years in a sequined dress!
links_reviews_text: I might have to make this a tradition! I rented a sequined dress for NYE last year and was happy to do it again. Rent by October to make sure you get your choice! It fit well and was comfy! It's short so just be careful hehehe.

Second great RTR dress rental. Wore this to two holiday parties. I'm 5'0" (plus 3" heels in this photo) and so the shorter hem was good on me. Fit felt true to size. The back has a low opening so a Nubra worked great. Got tons of compliments and loved it!

links_reviews_title: This was the perfect dress for Cher in concert!
links_reviews_text: The dress was a hit , I was complimented all night long. It is very short so be prepared to wear a boy short underneath.
I rented this for my bachelorette weekend and it was amazing!! Wore it with leather jacket and white boots. It was very short, but so cute, flattering, comfy. But of stretch too! Loved it

Beautiful- was very fitting & even though I sized a size up form my usual the arms were rather right. Maybe a size further up would have had the desired fit- but yes it IS very body con & curve hugging

I rented this for a Halloween party. I really liked it. I usually wear between M and L. I went with the L. I'm glad the L worked because the medium was beautiful but all white sequins while large could be silver or white. It was a little short and had a little rip but it wasn't noticeable. If not for the rip I would have given 5 stars
The fit overall is tts but boxy! We wore a blazer slim fit to give it more shape. Perfect for Vegas! Also definitely on the short side so boy short underwear works best underneath

This. Dress. Is. Everything. I felt like such a diva wearing this. It's not itchy on the inside, but slightly uncomfortable when sitting on a non padded chair. It fits a little roomy in the mid section. I would've worn the size small, but it was waaaay to short for my long legs and 5'9" height (I couldn't even bend down without showing a lot of skin). Highly recommend

Daughter wore his dress for homecoming and it was perfect. It was a tad on the short side but fit nicely. There is some stretch to it so the sizing is right on. We would have tried the large for added length but the large was not available. She is 5'9 and wore the medium and ended up being very comfortable.

This dress is amazing!! Don't rent if you don't want attention - you will be stopped all night long! The dress itself is heavy, I was worried about wearing it in the Vegas heat (late August), but it wasn't a problem at all! A show, country dancing, and a stint at the casino, this dress was comfortable and turned heads all night. I felt amaaaaazing wearing it. The sequins right at the armpits may irritate your skin a little, but turn them the opposite way, and keep on moving! It's nothing you'll feel tomorrow.

This dress is so sparkly! It has a little bit of stretch so it's comfortable and you can move around in it easily. The arm seams are really tight so if you have bigger arms take that into consideration. I didn't get to wear it to my event however because it was SO SHORT. I'm 5'5 and if I bent over you'd get a show.
